quoteFirst: English railways running into suburbs and near-by towns have a schedule which is expressly arranged to have the principal train leave before the lecture ends. Hence the 9-P.M.-train man. He sits right near the front, and at
quoteLast: he gathers up his hat, coat, and umbrella very deliberately, rises with great calm, and walks firmly away. His air is that of a man who has stood all that he can and can bear no more.

author: Leacock, Stephen, 1869-1944

quoteFirst: It began, so far as sinkings are concerned, with the destruction of the steamer _Margarette_ of Königsberg by gunfire, on October 5, 1915, and the most exciting day in the record was October 23, when the _Prinz Adalbert_, a cruiser of nearly 9,000 tons, fell to her first shot. E. 8 was cruising off Libau when, at
quoteLast: , Commander Goodhart observed smoke on the horizon, and altered course to intercept the ship which was soon seen to be an enemy. She had three funnels and two very high masts, and was going west with two destroyers, zigzagging--one on each bow.

quoteFirst: I rose at eight next morning, and making some sort of excuse to my mother, I kissed her, and went out with my father's sword under my cloak. Tallancourt had undertaken to provide a second sword. I reached the _hôtel de Nantes_ at
quoteLast: , and we found there my adversary's two seconds. I had not had any breakfast, for Thibaut, who accompanied us, had advised me not to eat, in case I might have to be bled. We waited: half-past nine, ten, eleven struck.

quoteFirst: An hour later he left Millstead quite undramatically by the 9.5. The taxi came to the door of Lavery's at
quoteLast: , while the school was in morning chapel; as he rode away and out of the main gates he could hear, faintly above the purr of the motor, the drone of two hundred voices making the responses in the psalms. It did not bring to his heart a single pang or to his eye a single tear.
